relatedanime.anime: Chii`s Sweet Home: Chii to Kocchi, Deau.

similaranime.anime: Kanojo to Kanojo no Neko: Everything Flows

anime.description: * Based on the Chii`s Sweet Home manga series written and illustrated by http://anidb.net/cr2146 [Konami Kanata] and serialised in Weekly Morning. http://anidb.net/ch7450 [Chii] is living happily with http://anidb.net/ch10238 [Youhei] while his http://anidb.net/ch10240 [father] and http://anidb.net/ch10239 [mother] continue to try and keep her presence a secret from the landlady. When a relative in Hokkaido offers to take Chii in, Youhei`s parents decide that it would be best for her if she moved away. With just a month left with the young kitten, they are finding it difficult to say goodbye. Upon receiving a phone call saying that Chii will be moving away sooner than expected, Youhei and his parents realize that they can`t give her up. Deciding once and for all that Chii is part of their family, Youhei`s parents promptly find a new place to live, one that allows pets. As the family prepares to move into their new apartment, will Chii be able to adapt to her new surroundings?

externalentity.identifier: チーズスイートホーム#.E7.AC.AC2.E6.9C.9F

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: moe
tag.description: Moe is a Japanese slang loanword that refers to feelings of strong affection mainly towards characters in anime, manga, and video games. Moe, however, has also gained usage to refer to feelings of affection towards any subject. Moe can be related to lust; however, pure lust without other feelings is considered outside its scope. The word Moe originated in the late 1980s and early 1990s in Japan and is of uncertain origin, although there are several theories on how it came into use. At the anime level, the http://anidb.net/t7146 [cute girls doing cute things (CGDCT)] tag may also apply. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: tsukkomi
tag.description: A tsukkomi is a comedy duo stock character in a traditional Japanese slapstick stand-up comedy style known as manzai. Tsukkomi characters are the smart, reasonable, and down-to-earth half of the unit; their simple-minded counterparts are the http://anidb.net/t1399 [boke] characters. As a result of their boke counterparts` simple mistakes and gross exaggerations, tsukkomi berate and abuse them both verbally and physically; a very common example of tsukkomi physical abuse is a paper fan slap, which is generally accompanied by a sound effect. Their approximate equivalent in Western culture is the comedy role of straight man.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: particularly suitable for children
tag.description: No sex or drugs, but probably rock and roll. Very watchable for children.

tag.name: animal protagonist
tag.description: The anime revolves around an animal, usually only communicating with typical onomatopoeia. The animal mostly lives in a human family and has adventures on a regular base. This can be the discovery of a new room, or being lost by having taken a wrong turn in the outside world. Typical example: http://anidb.net/a5801 [Chii`s Sweet Home]. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t4259 [animal world], where the whole world is composed of animals.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

character.name: Kuroino
character.description: Despite his intimidating appearance (earning him the nickname "bear-cat"), Kuroino takes Chii under his wing and eventually becomes Chii`s first cat friend.

Chii, Ameyadori Suru.
episode.summary: Chi is soaking wet from the rain. She goes with Tama-san to look for someplace to stay dry. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, びしょびしょになる.
Chii Gets Drenched.
Chii, Bishobisho ni Naru.
episode.summary: It suddenly began to rain and Chi got soaked! She went to find shelter from the rain with not much luck. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 星を願う.
Chii Wishes Upon a Star.
Chii, Hoshi o Negau.
episode.summary: Chi was disappointed when they moved the tree away. Yohei wrote down a wish as he looked at Chi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 笹をかざる.
Chii Trims The Bamboo Tree.
Chii, Sasa o Kazaru.
episode.summary: The Yamadas decorated their home with bamboo and small slips of paper to write wishes on in preparation for Tanabata. Chi became interested in these decorations. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, のりきる.
Chii Overcomes.
Chii, Norikiru.
episode.summary: Yohei and Chi are watching the house. Then suddenly, they get frightened by the sound of a chime and they began to scream! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 噛み合う.
Chii Is In Sync.
Chii, Kamiau.
episode.summary: Mom says Yohei and Chi act very similar to each other. At first, dad is a bit doubtful... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, おりる.
Chii Goes Down.
Chii, Oriru.
episode.summary: In order to save Chi, Ryu-kun does his best. In doing so, Ryu-kun overcomes his fear of cats. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 発見される.
Chii Is Discovered.
Chii, Hakken Sareru.
episode.summary: Chi climbs up a tree to where she sees a locust. When she looks down, she`s surprised about how high up she is. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, つけられる.
Chii Is Followed.
Chii, Tsukerareru.
episode.summary: Alice and Tama-san watch over Chi and have a mutual understanding of protecting her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, ごちそうになる.
Chii Is Treated.
Chii, Gochisou ni Naru.
episode.summary: Alice and Tama-san`s cooking battle! They are both making delicious food for Chi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 飛びつく.
Chii Leaps.
Chii, Tobitsuku.
episode.summary: Chi`s is ecstatic when she sees the balloon. It gets a bit crazy in the house which troubles mom a bit. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 人気者になる.
Chii Becomes Popular.
Chii, Ninkimono ni Naru.
episode.summary: Mom and Dad are trying to find Chi`s favorite toy which causes a bit of a commotion and tires Chi out. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 見上げる.
Chii Looks Up.
Chii, Miageru.
episode.summary: When Tama-san wasn`t paying attention to Chi for a mere second, she was sweep away by someone. Tama-san went to save her but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 経験する.
Chii Experiences.
Chii, Keiken Suru.
episode.summary: Tama-san is teaching Chi about the way of enjoying the festival. However, Chi begins to have her own carefree fun. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 連れられる.
Chii Gets Taken Away.
Chii, Tsurerareru.
episode.summary: Chi is watching the portable shrine for the first time and getting very excited. Tama-san is very fond of it and begins to talk about the festival Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, すくう.
Chii Scoops.
Chii, Sukuu.
episode.summary: The Yamadas are having Flowing Somen*. Chi`s has gotten pretty good at it when eventually something happens. *Somen is very thin, white Japanese noodles made of wheat flour. *Flowing Somen is when somen is put in water flowing along a long bamboo gutter. You catch the noodles with your chopsticks and dip them in the broth and eat it. Source: crunchyroll

Chii`s Sweet News 19
チー, ころぶ.
Chii Falls.
Chii, Korobu.
episode.summary: David noticed Chi`s situation. He dragged his owner, Kusano-kun, to go and save Chi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, じまんする.
Chii Boasts.
Chii, Jiman Suru.
episode.summary: Chi follows David on his walk and as she`s strolling along, falls into a garbage can. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, こわがらす.
Chii Scares People.
Chii, Kowagarasu.
episode.summary: At night, Yohei was frightened by a ghost. There were some sounds coming from the ceiling. What could it possibly be? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 馬にのる.
Chii Rides a Horse.
Chii, Uma ni Noru.
episode.summary: Chi goes to a farm. She starts to entertain herself when she does something to the horse. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 北海道を走る.
Chii Travels Around in Hokkaido.
Chii, Hokkaido o Hashiru.
episode.summary: They finally arrived to Hokkaido. Chi was extremely happy when she meets Julie-chan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 海をわたる.
Chii Crosses the Sea.
Chii, Umi o Wataru.
episode.summary: The Yamadas took a trip to Hokkaido. Everyone is together but they had to separate from Chi on the boat. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, キタキツネにあう.
Chii Meets a Red Fox.
Chii, Kitakitsune ni Au.
episode.summary: Chi meets a Northern fox. They both act similarly, get along and become friends. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 星を見る.
Chii Looks at the Stars.
Chii, Hoshi o Miru.
episode.summary: Julie-chan shows Yohei the thing she treasures the most. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 牛にあう.
Chii Meets a Cow.
Chii, Ushi ni Au.
episode.summary: Chi meets a cow for the first time. She is so happy but is accidentally stained with milk! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, とり囲まれる.
Chii Gets Surrounded.
Chii, Torikakomareru.
episode.summary: Chi found the chicks` pen and try to get to them until the parents of the chicks appear. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, いっしょに行く.
Chii Goes Together.
Chii, Issho ni Iku.
episode.summary: Chi is going to the cat meeting and Alice comes along and tries to fit in. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 感謝される.
Chii Is Shown Gratitude.
Chii, Kansha Sareru.
episode.summary: The pet store lady comes to visit Chi and brings her some pet clothes. When Chi runs away from the pet store lady`s dress-up session, Chi finds Youhei with Mrs. Yamada, playing with Mayu and Ryu. When the pet store lady finds her, there`s a surprise. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 庭で遊ぶ.
Chii Plays in the Garden.
Chii, Niwa de Asobu.
episode.summary: Kusano Yuki comes over to the Yamadas to play with David. Chi tries to play with David in the yard. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 付き添う.
Chii Chaperones.
Chii, Tsukisou.
episode.summary: Mr. Yamada has to work and can`t play with Chi; But Chi always cause trouble and can`t stay still. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チーズスイートニュース 23
Chii`s Sweet News 23
Chii`s Sweet News 23
チー, 種まきをする.
Chii Plants Seeds.
Chii, Tanemaki o Suru.
episode.summary: The Yamadas have a flower bed in their garden. As they are all sowing the garden, Chi gets in the way by playing. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 演奏する.
Chii Performs Music.
Chii, Ensou Suru.
episode.summary: Yohei is practicing the pianica but can’t seem to play it well as Chi comes along. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 話し合う.
Chii Has a Conversation.
Chii, Hanashiau.
episode.summary: Dad is running late to his meeting. When he opens his bag, he finds Chi there. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, からまる.
Chii Is Involved.
Chii, Karamaru.
episode.summary: Mom broke Chi’s toy so she decided to handmake a toy for her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, まちがう.
Chii Is Mistaken.
Chii, Machigau.
episode.summary: Chi reminisces about Kuroino. She sees something black in a stopped pickup truck that looks like Kuroino. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, あせる.
Chii Is in a Hurry.
Chii, Aseru.
episode.summary: The pickup truck that Chi’s on begins to move. Where will she be taken? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 囲まれる.
Chii Gets Surrounded.
Chii, Kakomareru.
episode.summary: Chi arrives at an unknown plot of land where three cats appear. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 泊まる.
Chii Stays.
Chii, Tomaru.
episode.summary: Chi stays with the cats that help her. The next morning, Chi is pointed in the right direction back to the Yamadas. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 倒れる.
Chii Collapses.
Chii, Taoreru.
episode.summary: Chi is pretty tired. She’s thinking about the Yamadas and heading home but… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 進む.
Chii Advances.
Chii, Susumu.
episode.summary: Again, Chi was on her way home but many things happened along the way. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 伝える.
Chii Conveys a Message.
Chii, Tsutaeru.
episode.summary: As Chi was on her way home, she ran into Tama-san’s younger sister, Hana-san. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 結ぶ.
Chii Makes a Family.
Chii, Musubu.
episode.summary: Chi finally returns home so they have a big party for her return! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, 駆ける.
Chii Runs.
Chii, Kakeru.
episode.summary: In an effort to find Chi, Yohei meets her at the place when they first met. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チー, もう一度約束する.
Chii Renews her Promise.
Chii, Mou Ichido Yakusoku Suru.

episode.title: チー, 喜ぶ.
Chii Is Happy.
Chii, Yorokobu.
